member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.AddInTree
member.summary: Static class containing the AddInTree. Contains methods for accessing tree nodes and building items.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Core.AddInTree.BuildItem(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Builds a single item in the addin tree.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Core.AddInTree.BuildItems(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Builds the items in the path.
member.param: A path in the addin tree.
The owner used to create the objects.
If true, throws an TreePathNotFoundException if the path is not found. If false, an empty ArrayList is returned when the path is not found.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Core.AddInTree.BuildItems``1(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Builds the items in the path. Ensures that all items have the type T. Throws an exception if the path is not found.
member.param: A path in the addin tree.
The owner used to create the objects.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Core.AddInTree.BuildItems``1(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Builds the items in the path. Ensures that all items have the type T.
member.param: A path in the addin tree.
The owner used to create the objects.
If true, throws an TreePathNotFoundException if the path is not found. If false, an empty ArrayList is returned when the path is not found.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.CompareConditionEvaluator
member.summary:
Compares two strings. The strings are passed through the StringParser, so it is possible to compare SharpDevelop properties.
Useful if you want to run a command only when a setting is active to prevent loading your addin if that setting isn't set.
member.attribute: The first string.
The second string.
The mode of the comparison: a field of the System.StringComparison enumeration. The default is 'InvariantCultureIgnoreCase'.

example.title: Check the value of a property in the PropertyService

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.IConditionEvaluator
member.summary: Interface for classes that can evaluate conditions defined in the addin tree.

member.summary: Condition evaluator that lazy-loads another condition evaluator and executes it.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.OwnerStateConditionEvaluator
member.summary: Condition evaluator that compares the state of the caller/owner with a specified value. The caller/owner has to implement .

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.ClassDoozer
member.summary: Creates object instances by invocating a type's parameterless constructor via System.Reflection.
member.attribute: The fully qualified type name of the class to create an instace of.
member.returns: Any kind of object.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.IDoozer
member.summary: Interface for classes that can build objects out of codons.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Core.IDoozer.HandleConditions
member.summary: Gets if the doozer handles codon conditions on its own. If this property return false, the item is excluded when the condition is not met.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Core.ClassDoozer.HandleConditions
member.summary: Gets if the doozer handles codon conditions on its own. If this property return false, the item is excluded when the condition is not met.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.FileFilterDoozer
member.summary: Creates file filter entries for OpenFileDialogs or SaveFileDialogs.

The extensions associated with this file filter entry.
member.returns: String in the format "name|extensions".

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Core.FileFilterDoozer.HandleConditions
member.summary: Gets if the doozer handles codon conditions on its own. If this property return false, the item is excluded when the condition is not met.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.IconDoozer
member.summary: Creates associations between file types or node types in the project browser and icons in the resource service.
member.attribute: The name of a bitmap resource in the resource service.
This attribute is specified when a project icon association should be created. It specifies the language of the project types that use the icon.
This attribute is specified when a file icon association should be created. It specifies the semicolon-separated list of file types that use the icon.
member.returns: An IconDescriptor object that exposes the attributes.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Core.IconDoozer.HandleConditions
member.summary: Gets if the doozer handles codon conditions on its own. If this property return false, the item is excluded when the condition is not met.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.IncludeDoozer
member.summary: Includes one or multiple items from another location in the addin tree. You can use the attribute "item" (to include a single item) OR the attribute "path" (to include all items from the target path).
member.attribute: When this attribute is used, the include doozer builds the item that is at the addin tree location specified by this attribute.
When this attribute is used, the include doozer builds all items inside the path addin tree location specified by this attribute and returns an which includes all items in the output list.
member.returns: Any object, depending on the included codon(s).

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Core.IncludeDoozer.HandleConditions
member.summary: Gets if the doozer handles codon conditions on its own. If this property return false, the item is excluded when the condition is not met.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.IBuildItemsModifier
member.summary: When a doozer returns an object implementing this interface, the method is called on the list of items that has been built. This interface can be used to support special doozers that do not simply build one item but want to modify the list of items built so far. Example use is the which uses this interface to return multiple items instead of one.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.LazyLoadDoozer
member.summary: This doozer lazy-loads another doozer when it has to build an item. It is used internally to wrap doozers specified in addins.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Core.LazyLoadDoozer.HandleConditions
member.summary: Gets if the doozer handles codon conditions on its own. If this property return false, the item is excluded when the condition is not met.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.AbstractCommand
member.summary: Abstract implementation of the interface.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.ICommand
member.summary: A basic command interface. A command has simply an owner which "runs" the command and a Run method which invokes the command.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Core.ICommand.Run
member.summary: Invokes the command.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Core.ICommand.Owner
member.summary: Returns the owner of the command.

member.name: E:ICSharpCode.Core.ICommand.OwnerChanged
member.summary: Is called when the Owner property is changed.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Core.AbstractCommand.Run
member.summary: Invokes the command.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Core.AbstractCommand.Owner
member.summary: Returns the owner of the command.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.MenuItemDoozer
member.summary: Creates menu items from a location in the addin tree.
member.attribute: Label of the menu item.
This attribute must be one of these values: Separator, CheckBox, Item=Command, Menu (=with subitems), Builder (=class implementing ISubmenuBuilder). Default: Command.
Only for the type "Item"/"Command". When set to false, the command class is loaded immediately instead of the usual lazy-loading.
Icon of the menu item.
Command class that is run when item is clicked.
Only for the type "Item"/"Command". Opens a webpage instead of running a command when clicking the item.
Shortcut that activates the command (e.g. "Control|S").
member.children: If "type" is "Menu", the item can have sub-menuitems.
member.usage: Any menu strip paths or context menu paths, e.g. /SharpDevelop/Workbench/MainMenu
member.returns: Any ToolStrip* object, depending on the type attribute.
member.conditions: Conditions are handled by the item, "Exclude" maps to "Visible = false", "Disable" to "Enabled = false"

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Core.MenuItemDoozer.HandleConditions
member.summary: Gets if the doozer handles codon conditions on its own. If this property return false, the item is excluded when the condition is not met.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.StringDoozer
member.summary: Creates a string.
member.attribute: The string to return.
member.returns: The string specified by 'text', passed through the StringParser.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Core.StringDoozer.HandleConditions
member.summary: Gets if the doozer handles codon conditions on its own. If this property return false, the item is excluded when the condition is not met.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.ToolbarItemDoozer
member.summary: Creates tool bar items from a location in the addin tree.
member.attribute: Label of the tool bar item.
Icon of the tool bar item.
This attribute must be one of these values: Separator, CheckBox, Item, ComboBox, DropDownButton
Only for the type "Item". When set to false, the command class is loaded immediately instead of the usual lazy-loading.
Tooltip of the tool bar item.
Command class that is run when item is clicked; or class that manages the ComboBox/DropDownButton. Required for everything except "Separator".
member.children: A drop down button has menu items as sub elements.
member.returns: A ToolStrip* object, depending on the type attribute.
member.conditions: Conditions are handled by the item, "Exclude" maps to "Visible = false", "Disable" to "Enabled = false"

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.Core.ToolbarItemDoozer.HandleConditions
member.summary: Gets if the doozer handles codon conditions on its own. If this property return false, the item is excluded when the condition is not met.

member.summary: Sets the directory name used for the property service. Must be set before StartCoreServices() is called. Use null to use the default path "ApplicationData\ApplicationName".

member.summary: Sets the data directory used to load resources. Must be set before StartCoreServices() is called. Use null to use the default path "ApplicationRootPath\data".

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Core.AddInManager.InstallAddIns(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Installs the AddIns from AddInInstallTemp to the UserAddInPath. In case of installation errors, a error message is displayed to the user and the affected AddIn is added to the disabled list.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.Core.AddInManager.LoadAddInConfiguration(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Loads a configuration file. The 'file' from XML elements in the form "<AddIn file='full path to .addin file'>" will be added to , the 'addin' element from "<Disable addin='addin identity'>" will be added to , all other XML elements are ignored.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.Core.AppDomainLaunchHelper
member.summary: Because AddIn assemblies are loaded into the LoadFrom context, creating AppDomains in them that use an arbitrary ApplicationBase path does not work correctly. This class contains a static method that helps launching a static method on a type in a new AppDomain.
